body: See https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/5401 can you provide an example of what it looks like before/after the offsets are applied?

Hi Chris, yes here are the before/after screen captures:
before - https://ibb.co/GT8jKFw
after - https://ibb.co/wYHF9TW
thx!

@kchibisov You've mentioned this originally in the PR where you adjusted all kinds of directions and I mentioned that Y position is probably the only one that makes sense. I'd be curious how you feel about this. Should we just adjust the underline Y position based on y offset?

Given that I've wrote the original patch we can adjust. I'm still sort of thinking that underline should also respect x, since it's attached to the text(underline position property), and not absolute position. Like it has clear offsets from the glyph and if we move glyph we should move the underline as well.

But it's up to you. You can resurrect my original patch. I don't mind.

Yeah I can see where you're coming from. Though just doing what is actually required is probably simplest for a minimal solution.

Given that the patch is already up and I personally don't care about figuring this out and testing it, I'll leave it to someone who's actually interested in using this feature to put up another patch. Since all the code is already written it shouldn't require much knowledge.

After https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/6584, this is how the undercurl looks like with positive `font.glyph_offset.y`

![20230102_164455](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55179750/210209888-83de9715-181f-4de0-a3ed-f5dec10fe051.jpeg)

Is this expected? Underline looks fine.

![20230102_164512](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55179750/210210183-71af3eba-d359-4b64-9092-8e30309ac954.jpeg)
@fitrh Could you share what it looks like without any offsets?
Also, with `offset.y = 10` `glyph_offset.y = 5` makes the undercurl invisible
@kchibisov Are you aware of any potential issues with the undercurls?
@fitrh Could you open another issue? Otherwise it'll likely get lost forever.

issue.title: undercurl get cut off for positive font/glyph offset.y
issue.body:
After https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/6584, as described here https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6561#issuecomment-1368785902, using a positive value for font/glyph offset.y causes the undercurl to cut off, in my case, `SF Mono:size=10` font with font/glyph offset.y is 10/5, undercurl wasn't even visible

> with offset
![20230115_143849](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55179750/212526892-3438750f-efd1-46c4-aba3-ec57cabe85ba.jpeg)

> without offset
![20230115_143919](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55179750/212526950-a28d0a28-789d-4854-94d0-503a0eade0f5.jpeg)

But, with font size = 19, undercurl is visible even with a higher offset.y

![20230115_144305](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55179750/212527025-b7f4405c-675e-4092-8633-027d7139ea36.jpeg)


### System

OS: Linux
Version: `alacritty 0.12.0-dev (2bd26fb)`
Linux: Wayland, river
